column4: I'm having an issue with chown, as root im getting "operation not permitted" on a mounted samba share
You don't chown shares. You have to pass them permissions at mount time.
okay can you help with that
what options do i need to look into?
Mount it with umask=000 as an option
saying line is bad, i have //server/share /local path smbfs username=adsf,password=adsf umask=000
i also tried putting umask on the inside of user/pass section
Oh, I should warn you that umask=000 gives 777 permissions. You might want to tone that down if that's too loose for you.
nothlit is ( I BELIEVE >=| ) talking to you.
is umask=000 the most unrestrive as far as permissions go?
Yes. As I said, 777. Anyone can do anything. It is the wikipedia of permissions.
